alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Excessive Heat Warning issued July 27 at 2:14PM CDT until July 28 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 112 during the afternoon and early evening especially. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While afternoon and early evening heat indices will be the hottest, overnight low temperatures will only briefing dip below 75 or 80 degrees in some areas.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Jewell; Mitchell; Osborne; Phillips; Rooks; Smith
